marketNews.title: Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan signals PPN 12% delay
marketNews.content: Chairman of the National Economic Council, Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan, said that the increase of value-added tax (VAT) to 12% effective 1 January 2025 is "almost certainly postponed", although the decision will still depend on the outcome of the government meeting. Luhut explained that the government plans to provide a stimulus first to the middle-class population through social assistance (bansos), intended as a cushion to mitigate the impact of the VAT hike. The assistance will not be given as direct cash aid (BLT), but as an electricity subsidy.

marketNews.title: US Personal Consumption Expenditures (PCE) Index
marketNews.content: The United States Personal Consumption Expenditures (PCE) index recorded a year-over-year increase to 2.3% in October 2024 (versus 2.1% in September 2024), matching consensus expectations. On a month-over-month basis, PCE inflation was 0.2% in October (same as September), also in line with consensus. The core PCE index, which the Federal Reserve uses as a long-term inflation indicator, remained stable at 0.3% month-over-month (same as September). Annually, core PCE inflation reached 2.8% year-over-year (versus 2.7% in September), meeting expectations and marking the highest level in the last six months.

marketNews.title: BYD requests 10% price cut from suppliers
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that BYD has asked its suppliers to accept a price reduction of 10% starting January 2025. The report is based on a screenshot circulating on the Chinese social media platform Weibo, showing BYD's request for a 10% discount from unnamed suppliers. BYD director Li Yunfei said that bargaining with suppliers is a common practice in the automotive industry and that the company can negotiate supply prices.

marketNews.title: MIND ID plans equity story for Inalum
marketNews.content: Director of Portfolio and Business Development at MIND ID, Dilo Seno Widagdo, said that the firm is currently preparing an equity story for PT Indonesia Asahan Aluminium (Inalum) to make it more attractive when offered to investors on the stock exchange. Although Dilo did not specify when Inalum will go public, he emphasized that funding needs are a key consideration for MIND ID to bring its subsidiaries to the market. MIND ID estimates its capital expenditure for 2025-2029 will reach 267.8 trillion rupiah, covering its four subsidiaries: Aneka Tambang (ANTM), Bukit Asam (PTBA), Timah (TINS), and Inalum.

marketNews.title: Bakmi GM considers strategic share sale
marketNews.content: DealStreetAsia reported that the operator of the Bakmi GM restaurant chain, PT Griya MieSejati, is considering a strategic sale of shares valued at 2.1 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: Alamtri Resources Indonesia (ADRO) shares fall 24.8% to auto-reject level
tickerNews.content: Alamtri Resources Indonesia (ADRO) shares fell 24.8% and touched the lower auto-reject (ARB) level at 2,760 rupiah per share on Thursday (28/11). The decline coincided with the ex-dividend date for a dividend of 2.6 billion US dollars that ADRO will distribute on 6 December 2024. ADRO will announce the dividend per share tomorrow, Friday (29/11). Assuming the dividend is paid at the maximum amount and using an exchange rate of 15,811 rupiah per US dollar, the dividend equals approximately 1,352 rupiah per share. In addition to the ex-dividend date, today is also the ex-rights date for the public offering rights (PUPS) of Adaro Andalan Indonesia (AADI), ADRO's thermal coal subsidiary that will be spun off soon. The PUPS price for AADI is estimated between 2.4 and 2.6 billion US dollars, depending on the volume-weighted average price (VWAP) on the first day the issuer lists on the exchange. Using the same exchange rate of 15,811 rupiah per US dollar, the price range translates to roughly 5,550-5,950 rupiah per share. Investors who have received AADI PUPS and wish to exercise them can do so between 6 and 10 December 2024. AADI itself will list on the IDX on 5 December 2024, with the initial public offering scheduled for 29 November-3 December 2024. The IPO price for AADI was set at 5,550 rupiah per share.

tickerNews.title: Adaro Andalan Indonesia (AADI) public offering rights (PUPS) details
tickerNews.content: In addition to the ex-dividend date, today is also the ex-rights date for the public offering rights (PUPS) of Adaro Andalan Indonesia (AADI), ADRO's thermal coal subsidiary that will be spun off soon. The PUPS price for AADI is estimated between 2.4 and 2.6 billion US dollars, depending on the volume-weighted average price (VWAP) on the first day the issuer lists on the exchange. Using an exchange rate of 15,811 rupiah per US dollar, the price range translates to roughly 5,550-5,950 rupiah per share. Investors who have received AADI PUPS and wish to exercise them can do so between 6 and 10 December 2024. AADI itself will list on the IDX on 5 December 2024, with the initial public offering scheduled for 29 November-3 December 2024. The IPO price for AADI was set at 5,550 rupiah per share.

tickerNews.title: United Tractors (UNTR) Komatsu sales reach 86.5% of 2024 target
tickerNews.content: United Tractors (UNTR) recorded sales of Komatsu heavy equipment amounting to 443 units (+19.4% month-over-month, +35.5% year-over-year) in October 2024. Cumulatively for the first ten months of 2024 (10M24), Komatsu sales reached 3,764 units (-19.8% year-over-year), representing 86.5% of the 2024 target of 4,350 units, with a market share of 27% (versus 27% in 9M24 and 30% in 10M23). In the mining contractor segment, UNTR recorded coal production volume of 125 million tonnes (+14.7% year-over-year) during 10M24, with overburden removal of 1 billion cubic metres (+6.8% year-over-year).

tickerNews.title: Cikarang Listrindo (POWR) interim dividend announcement
tickerNews.content: Cikarang Listrindo (POWR) will distribute an interim dividend for fiscal year 2024 amounting to approximately 28.1 million US dollars, equivalent to 28.2 rupiah per share. The cum-date is on the regular market and negotiation on 6 December 2024, with payment on 18 December 2024. Based on POWR's closing price on Thursday (28/11) at 705 rupiah per share, the implied dividend yield is 4%.

tickerNews.title: Golden Energy Mines (GEMS) interim dividend announcement
tickerNews.content: Golden Energy Mines (GEMS) will distribute an interim dividend for fiscal year 2024 amounting to approximately 90 million US dollars, or 0.0153 US dollars per share, equivalent to 242.7 rupiah per share assuming an exchange rate of 15,864 rupiah per US dollar. The cum-date is on the regular market and negotiation on 6 December 2024, with payment on 17 December 2024. Based on GEMS's closing price on Thursday (28/11) at 11,300 rupiah per share, the implied dividend yield is 1.5%. Previously, GEMS paid interim dividends for fiscal year 2024 in September 2024 and June 2024, each of 0.0255 US dollars per share.

tickerNews.title: Unilever Indonesia (UNVR) interim dividend announcement
tickerNews.content: Unilever Indonesia (UNVR) will distribute an interim dividend for fiscal year 2024 amounting to approximately 1.6 trillion rupiah, or 41 rupiah per share. The cum-date is on the regular market and negotiation on 4 December 2024, with payment on 19 December 2024. Based on UNVR's closing price on Thursday (28/11) at 1,885 rupiah per share, the implied dividend yield is 2.2%.

tickerNews.title: Cita Mineral Investindo (CITA) participation in ADMR new share issuance
tickerNews.content: Cita Mineral Investindo (CITA) announced that it has taken part in 176,556 (12.5%) of the new shares issued by Adaro Minerals Indonesia (ADMR) under the entity PT Kalimantan Aluminium Industry, valued at 176.6 billion rupiah. Besides CITA, other shareholders of PT Kalimantan Aluminium Industry also participated according to their respective ownership ratios. After the transaction, the ownership structure of PT Kalimantan Aluminium Industry remained unchanged: PT Adaro Indo Aluminium holds 65%, Aumay Mining Pte. Ltd. holds 22.5%, and CITA holds 12.5%.

tickerNews.title: Amman Mineral Internasional (AMMN) director purchases shares
tickerNews.content: The President Director of Amman Mineral Internasional, Alexander Ramlie, purchased approximately 1.4 million AMMN shares at an average price of 9,638 rupiah per share on 21-22 November 2024. The total transaction value reached roughly 13.6 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Ramlie's ownership in AMMN increased from 0.534% to 0.536%.

tickerNews.title: Bluebird Group Holding (BIRD) comments on BYD plant impact
tickerNews.content: Bluebird Group Holding Chief Commissioner Noni Purnomo told Bloomberg that the presence of a BYD plant in Indonesia could reduce electric-vehicle (EV) prices. Noni stated that EV prices for Bluebird are about 3.5 times higher than conventional car prices. Lower EV prices could help BIRD transform its fleet, with the company targeting EVs to represent 3% of the total fleet by 2025 and 20% by 2030. At the end of 2023, BIRD's total fleet was 23,000 vehicles, with 1% already electric. The BYD plant in Indonesia is expected to start operations in early 2026.

tickerNews.title: Sumber Global Energy (SGER) coal sales contract with Minergy Power Corporation
tickerNews.content: Sumber Global Energy (SGER) secured a coal sales contract with the Philippine company Minergy Power Corporation. The contract has a potential value of 10.94 million US dollars.

tickerNews.title: Waskita Karya (WSKT) targets new contract value of 14.5 trillion rupiah in 2024
tickerNews.content: Waskita Karya (WSKT) aims to obtain new contract value of 14.5 trillion rupiah in 2024, 14.2% lower than the 2023 realization of 16.9 trillion rupiah. WSKT recorded new contract value of 6.8 trillion rupiah (-48.1% year-over-year) during 10M24, representing 46.9% of the 2024 target. Director Rudi Purnomo said the company will announce additional new contracts worth 5.8 trillion rupiah by the end of 2024. WSKT is also participating in a tender for a private elevated toll-road project valued at 3 trillion rupiah and is exploring several building construction projects.

tickerNews.title: Siloam International Hospitals (SILO) appoints new commissioners and directors
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Siloam International Hospitals (SILO) approved the appointment of former Minister of Law and Human Rights (2014-2024), Yasonna H. Laoly, as the company's new President Commissioner. The shareholders also approved a new board of commissioners consisting of Toby Hall, Sigit Prasetya, Kartini Sjahrir, and Andy Purwohardono. For the board of directors, the shareholders approved the appointment of David Utama as President Director, and the appointment of Gabriele Isacco Tironi, Surya Tatang, and Richard Kidarsa as new directors.

tickerNews.title: Indika Energy (INDY) creates new logistics subsidiary
tickerNews.content: Indika Energy (INDY), through its two subsidiaries PT Indika Logistic & Support Services and PT Interport Mandiri Utama, has established a new subsidiary named PT Interport Sarana Infrastruktur Indonesia. The new subsidiary is intended for business expansion in the logistics sector.

tickerNews.title: Tamarin Samudra (TAMU) secures barge lease contract with Pertamina Hulu Energi OSES
tickerNews.content: Tamarin Samudra (TAMU) obtained a barge lease contract worth 194.7 billion rupiah from PT Pertamina Hulu Energi OSES. The contract will run until 31 May 2029.
